reviewText: I remember watching this movie as a child, really enjoyed this movie again. Did a little research on the boy, he did not make it past his twelve birthday. I like the movies ending much better.
summary: True story with a much happier ending

reviewText: I saw this one as well years ago when I was very young. More nostalgia for me, it's always neat to see big actors started small once too. The movie is neat to see how people really acted back in the day as well. Funny hair do's and talking like hippies as well. The movie is kind of neat too but pretty boring for today's standards.

reviewText: It was a cute little story.  I remember it from being on TV when I was little.  So of course, I had to see it again.  How young these two were, but still delivered - their acting was still growing, but not bad in this one.  I don't think it would be of interest to our young people, no cussing or sex - just innocent.  A little corny at the end, but hey it was the early late 70's early 80's.
summary: John and Linda - how long ago must we remember?

reviewText: This is a movie that came out in the 70s starring John Travolta and Glynnis O'Conner.  Both of whom were rising stars.  The movie is great.  I purchased it as one of two DVDs for my sister.  She loves the movie and had her two children watch as well.
